ygData.subject: Re: word of possession(happy99)
ygData.msgSnippet: Did you stop to think that there may be some NEW Internet users included in this mailing list that haven t actually been well versed on viruses yet?  There are
ygData.messageBody:
Did you stop to think that there may be some NEW Internet users included in
this mailing list that haven't actually been well versed on viruses
yet? There are a lot of new people..thousands daily. I don't see that
everyone is taught in advance of the things that could come from opening
.exe files they get in e-mail. It looks innocuous enough when they get
it. Lots of new people end up with infected systems from things happening
just like this.
Personally, I am well versed and I know what to do and what not to do to
assure that I don't have something on my system I don't want, BUT, there
are many new people who aren't. The anger is directed towards what can
happen to users who are not educated to these things rather than the folks
who already know what's up with attachments.
The person who sent that out is also a 15 year old boy. I checked his
profile and unless he is fibbing (doubtful or he woulda said he is older
:) ) then he is about 10th grade in high school.



At 01:54 PM 5/16/99 -0700, you wrote:
>From: <kalekona@...>
>
>O.K. people.
>
>You have nothing to fear from viruses in E-Mail.
>
>If you don't download attachments then you are fine...A
>virus CANNOT be sent by E-Mail. Only by attachments.
>
>You can even open the E-Mail without fear...just DO NOT open
>the attachment.
>
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>The Final Countdown is here!
>http://www.ONElist.com
>Join the "Star Wars" craze at ONElist.
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>This list is intended for the trade of Spell components for spell
>research. Please keep the emails on topic.
